element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Preserve the rural atmosphere of the community and assure “elbow room” in areas designated for lower density development by guiding new development into the Urban Core to conform to the historic Colony land use patterns of the City and to respect the natural environment, hillside areas, and existing neighborhoods.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure the rural character of Atascadero is preserved by respecting the historic Colony boundaries and cooperate with the County on regional planning issues surrounding the Colony.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Enhance the rural character and appearance of the City, including commercial corridors, gateways and public facilities.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that “darkness” remain a rural characteristic by requiring that all exterior lighting does not result in significant off-site spillage or glare.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that new development is compatible with existing and surrounding neighborhoods.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Allow for the orderly development of neighborhoods by allowing for the consideration of lot size reductions for lots that are significantly larger than the surrounding neighborhood.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Incorporate Pedestrian and Transit Oriented design concepts into new residential and commercial development within the Urban Core.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage retail businesses at efficient and attractive nodes along El Camino Real and Morro Road with mixed office and residential uses between those nodes.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Cooperate with the Atascadero Main Street Organization to promote downtown as the City’s cultural, entertainment, and commercial center, and to concentrate governmental facilities downtown.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Enhance the appearance of the downtown area and improve pedestrian circulation.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Reduce multi-family densities and increase single-family lot sizes as site slope increases.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Require hillside development and subdivisions to blend in with surrounding topography.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Prevent unnecessarily intensive grading of development sites.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that development does not degrade scenic and sensitive areas, including historic sites, creeks, riparian corridors, wetlands, woodlands, hillsides and other valuable habitats.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Protect prehistoric cultural resources from disturbance associated with development.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage conservation and preservation of neighborhoods, Colony Homes and sound housing, including places and buildings of historical and architectural significance.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage conservation and preservation of structures and houses that have historical and architectural significance.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that the native trees of Atascadero are protected from new development in order to retain the natural character of the community.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Protect and replenish native tree populations, including saplings.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that development along Atascadero Creek, Graves Creeks, the Salinas River, blue line creeks, and natural springs, lakes, or other riparian areas does not interrupt natural flows or adversely impact riparian ecosystems and water quality.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Establish and maintain setbacks and development standards for creek side development.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Preserve public creek reserves for public access, and ensure that recreational use does not impact habitat value and open space qualities.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Review and regulate all proposed on-site wastewater disposal systems to protect public health and water quality.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: The City shall implement a storm water control program consistent with the requirements of the National Pollution Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Permit Program (Phase II).

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Allow agricultural practices, including keeping livestock and farm animals, on parcels of appropriate size in Rural Estate, Suburban Estate, and Single Family Residential areas, provided that natural features and residential neighbors will not be adversely impacted.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Adequately regulate allowed agricultural practices and keeping of domestic animals on rural and agricultural lands consistent with the farm animal regulations of the City Zoning Ordinance.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure efficient and adequate solid waste disposal by reducing waste volumes through recycling and other methods.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Support ongoing water conservation efforts.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Support regional efforts to maintain clean air.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that development in mineral resource areas is appropriate and compatible with existing uses.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage soil conservation by minimizing grading and preventing erosion.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Utilize new technologies to improve convenience for City residents, reduce dependency on nonrenewable resources, increase ecological and financial efficiencies, and better inform the citizenry.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Acquire parkland needed for future development of park and recreation facilities and ensure that park improvements are consistent with adopted master plans to accommodate future growth.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage joint use of school facilities for public recreation purposes.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage park development on or adjacent to schools where appropriate.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage cooperative park and facility development programs.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Develop a method of financing park and recreational facilities and services throughout the City using a variety of revenue sources.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Provide specialized recreation opportunities based on projected needs and standards identified in parks master plans.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Emphasize the importance of recreation facilities as community resources.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Develop and implement a program to improve water quality in Atascadero Lake with specific water quality standards to be provided in the Parks and Recreation Master Plan.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Facilitate convenient location of goods and services needed by local residents.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage planned office development in appropriate locations.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Expand tourist commercial nodes to serve the traveling public at freeway interchanges and develop tourist destinations based on the Atascadero's rural character.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: The City shall continue to take a long range view of its fiscal condition, and specifically the possibility of enhancing revenues, in order to maintain and, where ever possible and desirable, enhance current levels of service.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Encourage existing uses to continue providing needed products and services.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Attract new development and land uses that provide jobs and services for residents, provided that those uses are consistent with the City’s character.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Plan for a regional commercial center near Highway 101.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that City regulations and processes support economic development opportunities.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Growth should be directed to areas where services can be provided in a cost-effective manner.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Maintain an updated Capital Improvements Program (CIP) that forecasts needs at least five years into the future and conforms to General Plan policies and programs.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that adequate service capacity and facilities exist prior to approving new development.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Extend services only when the City has funding for additional improvements identified in the CIP.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Two tiers of public service will be provided within the City based on the Urban Services Line (USL).

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure that new development pays the cost of providing and/or installing all capital facilities needed to support it, including the infrastructure necessary to attract high-tech and professional support businesses.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Continue to support effective regional planning for solid and hazardous waste disposal.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Support expansion of the County library.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Ensure high quality educational facilities and services are provided to the community.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: Require public agency and private utilities development projects in the City to conform to City site improvement standards.

element: Land Use, Open Space and Conservation Element
policy_text: The General Plan shall be adopted by City Council resolution.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Plan, fund and implement circulation improvements necessary to comply with adopted City safety and level of service standards, and the General Plan Circulation Diagram.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Provide regional facilities to minimize through-traffic intrusion on local streets and to avoid barriers to local traffic.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Maintain LOS C or better as the standard at all intersections and on all arterial and collector roads. Upon City Council approval, accept LOS D where residences are not directly impacted and improvements to meet the City’s standard would be prohibitively costly or disruptive.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Preserve the winding, tree-lined nature of the city street system in hillside areas.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Maintain an adequate and well-designed supply of off-street parking, particularly in commercial, industrial, and higher- density residential areas.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Provide for a comprehensive system of creekside trails, roadside pathways, equestrian trails, multi-use trails and bikeways to connect neighborhoods, schools, commercial, and recreation areas, in accordance with the Bikeway and Trail Plan.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Accommodate bicycles at major destinations including downtown, bus stops, schools, and other public facilities.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Promote walking as an alternative to vehicle travel in retail district and multi-family areas.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Promote alternatives to single-occupancy vehicle travel, particularly for commute trips.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Encourage expansion of public transit as needed to meet the changing needs of the area for local and regional access, including fixed route and demand response where appropriate.

element: Circulation Element
policy_text: Comply with the Transportation Demand Management program requirements of the San Luis Obispo County Clean Air Plan to reduce peak period trip generation.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Support response programs that provide emergency and other services to the public when a disaster occurs.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Help prepare and organize residents to respond appropriately to disasters.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Coordinate with County and State agencies, news media, and others working to reduce the risks of disasters through effective preparedness, response and recovery.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Expand and update the database of safety related information, including Geographic Information System (GIS) data, and convey that information to the public and decision makers.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Perform assessments aimed at reducing or eliminating long-term risks to improve the efficiency and decrease the cost of disaster response and recovery.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Facilitate long-term recovery following a disaster.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Enforce federal regulations regarding placement of structures in floodplains, and maintain appropriate standards for development in flood-prone and poorly drained areas (refer to Figure II-8).

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Reduce flood damage in areas known to be prone to flooding.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Prepare the City to respond to flood emergencies.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Minimize the risk of dam failure.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Carefully site and configure new development in higher fire risk areas

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Plan for adequate facilities, equipment, and personnel to meet fire fighting demands.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Sustain the ability of the Fire Department to respond to emergencies.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Adopt programs to reduce the impacts of fires.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Ensure that developments, structures, and public facilities adequately address geologic and seismic hazards.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Ensure that structures are designed and located to withstand strong groundshaking, liquefaction, and seismic settlement.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Avoid development in areas at risk for slope failure when possible, and ensure that hillside developments employ appropriate design and construction techniques.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Improve the ability of City personnel and residents to respond to seismic emergencies.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Reduce the potential for exposure to humans and the environment from hazardous substances.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Reduce the potential for pesticide exposure to humans and the environment.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Minimize potential hazards and spills from oil and gas pipelines and underground storage tanks.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Support County efforts to maintain a high level of radiation emergency preparedness and ensure that the public receives necessary information about the Diablo Canyon Power Plant.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Address unreinforced masonry buildings consistent with State Law.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: The noise standards in this chapter represent maximum acceptable noise levels. New development should minimize noise exposure and noise generation. The City shall maintain a Noise Ordinance that implements the requirements of the Noise Element.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: New development of noise-sensitive land uses shall not be permitted in areas exposed to existing or projected future levels of noise from transportation noise sources which exceed 60 dBn or CNEL (70 Ld,/CNEL for playgrounds and neighborhood parks) unless the project design includes effective mitigation measures to reduce noise in outdoor activity areas and interior spaces to or below the levels specified for the given land use in Table IV-3.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Noise created by new transportation noise sources, including roadway improvement projects, shall be mitigated so as not to exceed the levels specified in Table IV-3 within the outdoor activity areas and interior spaces of existing noise sensitive land uses..

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: New development of noise-sensitive land uses shall not be permitted where the noise level due to existing stationary noise sources will exceed the noise level standards of Table IV-4 unless effective noise mitigation measures have been incorporated into the design of the development to reduce noise exposure to or below the levels specified in Table IV-4.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: Noise created by new proposed stationary noise sources or existing stationary noise sources which undergo modifications that may increase noise levels shall be mitigated so as not to exceed the noise level standards of Table IV-4 on lands designated for noise-sensitive uses. This policy does not apply to noise levels associated with agricultural operations.

element: Safety and Noise Element
policy_text: The City shall consider implementing mitigation measures where existing noise levels produce significant noise impacts to noise-sensitive land uses or where new development may result in cumulative increases of noise upon noise-sensitive land uses.
